Articles.Content:
If any of you are willing to help me :)

Please add me on Skype: Pasta549 (Mr.Kitty) I will generally accept right away seeing as I'm on all the time

Please I just need some help landing, orbiting and such!

And yes I have watched scott manleys videos but they dont help !!!

Looking forward to seeing some help on Skype
It would be easier if you just let us help you here, as some of us to want to show our faces/voices. If you give us your pronblem, we would be more than glad to help.

Really? Scott Manley doesn't help you? In which way do his videos not help? Anyways, to take off, you simply launch vertically until you reach around 10 km, then pitch over to about 45 degrees, keeping an eye on your time to apoapsis: if it decreases, pitch back up to closer to 90 degrees. The most efficient launches have you follow the prograde vector the whole time. Landing is essentially the opposite: follow the retrograde vector, and attempt to kill both your vertical and lateral velocities before you touch down.

Welcome to the forums!

There are tons of tutorials in the Drawing Board (link in my sig) that might help you out quite a bit. If you still have questions, feel free to ask, but we'll need details about what exactly the problem is.
Check out my sig for some help... These guys have sorted some good info for you.
If you watch a few of Scotts videos and google some of the terms he uses it can become quite easy understand
Well I don't....posting on the forums *In my opinion* is not as easy as voice communication
